Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which New York state subsidizes private colleges, as it states that New York subsidizes private colleges "probably more than any other state except maybe one."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough specific data or evidence to support the assertion that New York state subsidizes private colleges more than any other state except possibly one.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the amount of need-based grants provided by a state is the sole indicator of how much the state subsidizes private colleges, without considering other forms of financial support or assistance.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the differences in need-based grant programs and amounts between New York and other states, such as variations in cost of living or different priorities in allocating financial aid.
